    How to update nested state properties in React

    üß©Reference links:

    • How State Updates Are Merged in React
    • How to Update Nested State Properties in React

    How to update nested state by using setState()

    this.state = {
    name: 'Bob',
    isLoggedIn: true,
    address: {
        street: '44 One Tree Ridge Road',
        city: null
    }

    Following the logic of shallow merging, you might try to update the value of ‚Äúaddress.city‚Äù for the state object illustrated above with the method setState( ) like this‚Ä¶

    this.setState({
    address: {
        city: 'Auckland'
    }
})

    However, this will change the state object‚Äôs structure to look something like:

    this.state = {
    name: 'Bob',
    isLoggedIn: true,
    address: {
        city: 'Auckland'
    }
}

    We lost ‚Äúaddress.street‚Äù within the state object because the nested object (value of the key ‚Äúaddress‚Äù) got overwritten by a new object with a single key of ‚Äúcity‚Äù. The logic of shallow merging does not apply for nested objects.

    How do we update the value for ‚Äúaddress.city‚Äù without totally overwriting the nested object (and thus saving the ‚Äúaddress.street‚Äù information)? In other words, is there a way to deep merge? There are multiple ways to tackle this but the spread operator provides us a feasible solution.

    this.setState({
    address: {
        ...this.state.address,
        city: 'Auckland'
    }
})

    The code above is a redo of the setState( ) implementation. We pass in a new version of state holding the key of ‚Äúaddress‚Äù. The value of this new object being passed into setState( ) includes a spread operator, which returns all of the keys and values from within the initial ‚Äúthis.state.address‚Äù object.

    1. Since this initial ‚Äúthis.state.address‚Äù object already had a key of ‚Äúcity‚Äù, supplying a new value for the key of ‚Äúcity‚Äù will overwrite the original value.
    2. If a key of ‚Äúcity‚Äù hadn‚Äôt been in the original ‚Äúthis.state.address‚Äù object, it will have been added via this setState( ) method.

    With this implementation of setState( ) the updated state object will look like (with the ‚Äúaddress.street‚Äù information still intact):

    {
    name: 'Bob',
    isLoggedIn: true,
    address: {
        street: '44 One Tree Ridge Road',
        city: 'Auckland'
    }
}

    To recap, React.Component‚Äôs setState( ) uses shallow merging to update state, ultimately saving us from listing out all of the keys and values from the initial state object. We can‚Äôt, however, apply the same logic of shallow merging on nested state objects. For these kinds of object structures, we can make use of the handy spread operator.

    How to update nested state by using React Hook‚Äôs setState

    const [reservation, setReservation] = useState({
    roomId: '',
    customer: {
      email: null,
      first_name: null,
      last_name: null,
      telephone: null,
    },
});

    Âú®ËøôÈáåÔºåÊàëÊúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™Â∑≤ÁªèÊã•ÊúâÂÄºÁöÑÂèòÈáèÔºåguest„ÄÇÊàëÁöÑ‰ªªÂä°ÊòØÂ∞ÜguestÁöÑÂÄºËµãÁªôreservation.customer„ÄÇ

    const guest = {
    email: 'john@gmail.com',
    first_name: 'John',
    last_name: 'Don',
    telephone: '020-8694-5463',
}

    Âú®‰πãÂâçÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫‰∏ÄÁõ¥Êêû‰∏çÊáÇHook‰∏≠ÁöÑsetState()ÁöÑËøê‰ΩúÂéüÁêÜÔºåÂΩìÂá∫Áé∞Á±ª‰ººnested objectËµãÂÄºÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢òÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÔºåÊàë‰ºöÁªïÂºÄuseState()ÔºåÁõ¥Êé•‰ΩøÁî®=ËµãÂÄº„ÄÇÂ±ûÂÆûÈìÅÊÜ®ÊÜ®„ÄÇ

    reservation.customer = guest;

    ÁÑ∂ÂêéÂú®ÊêûÊòéÁôΩÂéüÁêÜ‰∫Ü‰ª•ÂêéÔºåÊàëÂºÄÂßã‰∫ÜÂÆûÈ™å„ÄÇ

    reservation: {
    ...reservation.customer,

    first_name: guest.first_name,
    last_name: guest.last_name,
    telephone: guest.telephone,
    },
});

    ÂΩì‰ΩøÁî®setReservationÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÔºå()ÊåáÂêëÁöÑÔºåÂ∞±ÊòØreservationÊú¨Ë∫´„ÄÇËøôÂíåthis.setState()‰∏çÂêåÔºåthis.setState()ÁöÑÊã¨Âè∑ÊåáÂêëstate„ÄÇÈîôËØØÂú®‰∫éÔºå‰∏äÈù¢ÁöÑ‰ª£Á†ÅÂÆûÈôÖ‰∏äÊòØÂú®reservation‰∏≠ÔºåÂèàÂä†‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™reservationÂ±ûÊÄßÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÊääguestÁöÑÂÄº‰º†‰∫ÜËøõÂéª„ÄÇÊâÄ‰ª•‰ª•‰∏ä‰ª£Á†ÅÁöÑÁªìÊûúÊòØÔºö

    ÂÆûÈ™å‰∫åÂè∑‰∏é‰∏âÂè∑

    ÂæàÊòéÊòæ„ÄÇËøôÊ¨°ÔºåÊàëÊêûÊòéÁôΩ‰∫ÜÔºåÂà∞Â∫ïË∞ÅÊòØreservationÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÁü•ÈÅì‰∫ÜÊÄé‰πàÁî® Spread Operator Êõ¥Êñ∞ÂÆÉ„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊòØÊàëÊ≤°ÊúâÁî®Âà∞pre„ÄÇ

    setReservation(pre => {
    return {
        ...reservation,
        customer: {
            ...reservation.customer,
            first_name: guest.first_name,
            last_name: guest.last_name,
            email: guest.email,
            telephone: guest.telephone,
        },
    };
});

    ÊúÄÁªàÔºåÁî®Âà∞‰∫ÜpreState„ÄÇ

    setReservation(preReservation => {
    return {
        ...preReservation,
        customer: {
            ...preReservation.customer,
            first_name: guest.first_name,
            last_name: guest.last_name,
            email: guest.email,
            telephone: guest.telephone,
        },
    };
});
